intro: Turritis rigida, commonly known as rigid turritis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its upright, branching stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a feathery appearance. Turritis rigida is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
